meanings.definition: Exceeding the standard weight or amount.
meanings.sent1: The overweights suitcase was too heavy for the small child to carry.
meanings.sent2: The doctor advised the patient to avoid overweights meals to maintain a healthy lifestyle.
meanings.sent3: The overweights pumpkin won first place at the county fair for being the heaviest.
meanings.sent4: Her overweights backpack of worries seemed to drag her down wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: The overweights elephant in the room was impossible to ignore.

meanings.definition: To give excessive importance or influence to.
meanings.sent1: She overweights her own opinions and rarely listens to others.
meanings.sent2: The media tends to overweights celebrity gossip rather than important news.
meanings.sent3: He always overweights the value of material possessions over experiences.
meanings.sent4: The boss overweights the opinion of the new employee, causing tension in the team.
meanings.sent5: The teacher warned the students not to overweights grades above learning and personal growth.

meanings.definition: To outweigh in importance or significance.
meanings.sent1: The benefits of exercise overweights the temporary discomfort of working out.
meanings.sent2: In their decision-making process, they always consider which factors overweights the others.
meanings.sent3: The excitement of the upcoming vacation overweights any stress from work.
meanings.sent4: His passion for music overweights his interest in other hobbies.
meanings.sent5: The safety of the passengers overweights the speed of the train.
